channel.title: Immersive + Emerging Tech + Science Podcasts
channel.description: Curated podcast episodes and AI-generated paper summaries on volumetric displays, neural interfaces, neuromorphic computing, spatial computing, and related deep tech.

item.title: [The Peter Attia Drive] A new frontier in neurosurgery: restoring brain function with brain-computer interfaces, advancing glioblastoma care, and new hope for devastating brain diseases | Edward Chang, M.D.
item.description: View the Show Notes Page for This Episode Become a Member to Receive Exclusive Content Sign Up to Receive Peter's Weekly Newsletter Edward Chang is a neurosurgeon, scientist, and a pioneering leader in functional neurosurgery and brain-computer interface technology, whose work spans the operating room, the research lab, and the engineering bench to restore speech and movement for patients who have lost these capabilities. item.title: [Huberman Lab] Enhance Your Learning Speed & Health Using Neuroscience Based Protocols | Dr. Poppy Crum
item.description: My guest is Dr. Poppy Crum, PhD, adjunct professor at Stanford, former Chief Scientist at Dolby Laboratories and expert in neuroplasticity‚Äîour brain‚Äôs ability to change in response to experience. She explains how you can learn faster and ways to leverage your smartphone, AI and even video games to do so. We also discuss ‚Äúdigital twins‚Äù and the future of health technology. This episode will change the way you think about and use technology and will teach you zero-cost protocols to vastly improve

item.title: [Paperleap podcast] OLEDs may be the key to holography
item.description:
Researchers at the University of¬†St Andrews have demonstrated that pairing OLEDs with metasurfaces and filters can project holographic images without the need for lasers. This compact, safe, and scalable approach could pave the way for everyday holographic displays in consumer devices.
Read the full article at https://www.paperleap.com/blog/articles/oleds-may-be-the-key-to-holography-0cccyq

In this solo episode of the Age Well Home & Lifestyle Podcast, Kelly Bradley, licensed physical therapist, interior designer, and founder of Age Well Home & Lifestyle, explores the fascinating science of neuroaesthetics‚Äîthe study of how beauty, art, and design influence the brain, body, and aging process.
You‚Äôll discover how everything from color, light, and texture to architecture, sound, and nature directly impacts mood, stress, and longevity. Ke

item.title: [Breakthrough Broadcast] Floating on Sound: The Physics Behind Acoustic Levitation
item.description: I‚Äôm Drew, and in this episode of Breakthrough Broadcast, we‚Äôre exploring a technology that looks like science fiction but is entirely real: acoustic levitation. Imagine droplets of water, tiny beads, or bits of plastic hovering in midair‚Äîno strings, no magnets, just sound. Using carefully arranged sound waves, scientists can suspend objects, move them, and even merge them together while they float. We‚Äôll break down how it works, from the physics of standing waves to the invisible ‚Äúnodes‚Äù that ho

item.title: [Ancient Mysteries Unearthed] Sound Levitation Technology: Did the Ancients Know How To Use Advanced Sound Frequency Technology?
item.description:
Ancient Mysteries Unearthed Podcast | Episode #10
In this episode, Chris & Brandon discuss the incredible technology knows as sound levitation. This is perhaps one of the ancient methods to move, cut, shape and potentially even melt rock. We look at modern uses of sound (acoustic) levitation as well as ancient accounts. Enjoy!

item.title: [This Week in Startups] Why We Need Ferries and Tugboats in Space w/ Orbital Operations | E2208
item.description: üëâ¬†Register here to join the kickoff:¬†https://luma.com/cm0x90mk Today‚Äôs show: Just getting our stuff into orbit isn‚Äôt enough‚Ä¶ Orbital Operations wants to help companies take things HIGHER. In today‚Äôs TWiST 500 interview, Alex chats with Ben Schleuniger, whose startup Orbital Operations is solving the complexity of space logistics. The advent of reusable rockets has made it easier and cheaper than ever for us to place objects in Low Earth Orbit (or LEO). But what if we want to reach higher orbits?

item.title: [Waveform: The MKBHD Podcast] CES 2026 Actually Has Some Bangers?
item.description:

We start off with a few quick updates before getting into everything from the new Pickle AR glasses that were announced to holograms and the Clicks communicators. item.title: [The Carmen Murray Show - Conscious LeadHERS] S03 #165 The Future of Organoid Intelligence
item.description:
Can brain cells fix the AI energy crisis?
AI is devouring the planet‚Äôs energy, but what if the solution isn‚Äôt silicon‚Ä¶ its biology? In this episode, Carmen Murray explores Organoid Intelligence, computers grown from living brain cells that could revolutionize energy efficiency, reshape AI, and redefine what ‚Äúintelligence‚Äù means.
Discover how science is blurring the line between life and technology, and why it might just be the key to a sustainable digital future. website ¬∑ podcast studio ¬∑

item.title: [632nm] Snell's Law, Metasurfaces, and Metalenses | Federico Capasso
item.description: How can flat surfaces shape light as powerfully as bulky lenses? In this episode, we speak with Federico Capasso, Harvard physicist and pioneer of metasurfaces, metalenses, and nanophotonics. Capasso traces the path from his work at Bell Labs on quantum cascade lasers to the invention of metasurface optics, showing how a practical challenge‚Äîcollimating light without traditional lenses‚Äîsparked a new way to control light. We explore the physics behind metasurfaces and generalized Snell‚Äôs law, expl

item.description: Our heroes have one last hurdle to make it into TV Land: a car chase with obviously legit physics. Music by Anna Bosnick. Support us on Patreon!

item.title: [Explain It to Me] Battling brain rot
item.description:
Bland colors, AI summaries, and declining literacy rates have lots of us worried that we‚Äôre losing our intelligence to the modern world. Can we get it back?
This episode was produced by Ariana Aspuru, edited by Jenny Lawton, fact-checked by Melissa Hirsch, engineered by Patrick Boyd, and hosted by Jonquilyn Hill. Photo By BSIP/UIG Via Getty Images.¬†

item.title: [Huberman Lab] Science & Tools of Learning & Memory | Dr. David Eagleman
item.description: Dr. David Eagleman, PhD, is a neuroscientist, bestselling author and professor at Stanford University. We discuss how to leverage the science of neuroplasticity to learn new skills and information and how accurate and false memories form and are forgotten. We also discuss time perception and why it speeds up or slows down depending on our age and stress level. We cover dreaming and the meaning of visual and other dream content. And we discuss the neuroscience of cultural and political polarizati
